subject: control: command line tool to retrieve fan status (reload function)
commitMessage:
control: command line tool to retrieve fan status (reload function)

This creates a fan control command line utility to report service status,
show target/actual RPM/PWM info, report present/functional status as
retrieved from D-Bus (or "Unknown" if not supported), and set target
RPM/PWM speeds for one or more fans. A "reload" command restarts the fan
control service to allow reload of configuration files. Note: reload
is only available for JSON-enabled configuration, YAML-based systems
emit an error when reload is run.

sample output:

root@p10bmc:~# fanctl status
Fan Control Service State   : loaded, inactive(dead)
CurrentBMCState     : xyz.openbmc_project.State.BMC.BMCState.Ready
CurrentPowerState   : xyz.openbmc_project.State.Chassis.PowerState.Off
CurrentHostState    : xyz.openbmc_project.State.Host.HostState.Off

 FAN        TARGET(RPM)  FEEDBACKS(RPMS)   PRESENT     FUNCTIONAL
===============================================================
 fan0              9777       9777/13267      true         true
 fan1              9777       9777/13267      true         true
 fan2              9777       9777/13267      true         true
 fan3              9777       9777/13267      true         true
 fan4              9777       9777/13267      true         true
 fan5              9777       9777/13267      true         true
root@p10bmc:~# fanctl set 8000 fan0 fan1
root@p10bmc:~# fanctl get
TARGET SENSOR    TARGET(RPM)   FEEDBACK SENSOR   FEEDBACK(RPM)
===============================================================
fan0_0                  8000            fan0_0             8000
                                        fan0_1            10691
fan1_0                  8000            fan1_0             8000
                                        fan1_1            10691
fan2_0                  9777            fan2_0             9777
                                        fan2_1            13267
fan3_0                  9777            fan3_0             9777
                                        fan3_1            13267
fan4_0                  9777            fan4_0             9777
                                        fan4_1            13267
fan5_0                  9777            fan5_0             9777
                                        fan5_1            13267
root@p10bmc:~# fanctl reload
root@p10bmc:~#

Signed-off-by: Mike Capps <mikepcapps@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I19f25a2c47ffb84b1771fda4ea6ad17a9c78b8ec

Change has been successfully merged by Mike Capps

Would WANT_CONTROL_UTILITY be clearer?

It is a little confusing because there are 3 unrelated things that have the word control:
* WANT_CONTROL -- the new utility program
* WANT_JSON_CONTROL -- using JSON vs. YAML
* phosphor-fan-control -- app that does fan control

WANT_CONTROL is an existing option that says if the fan control package is enabled.  Since this makefile won't even be included (via configure.ac) if --enable-control isn't used, then you probably don't actually need this check at all.
Done

Missing reload.  Note comment in earlier commit about perhaps using the built-in support for enums so you don't need to make the same change in three places (option definition, calling associated function, help text).
Done
if you stick with this help function, I don't see 'reload' here.
Done

I didn't see a response to

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-fan-presence/+/44626/8/control/Makefile.am#39

Not a big deal, but a little confusing.

Sorry, in my earlier comments I didn't mean that all output should be written to cerr.

I'm not sure if this utility has special requirements, but normally Unix programs do the following:
* Write normal output to stdout / std::cout
* Write error output to stderr / std::cerr

This allows you to redirect them to different destinations if necessary, and depending on the console settings may cause the error output to look different.

This comment applies in many places in this file.
Done
Done
I think Matt had wanted the issue reference removed?
Done
Nit: Not sure why this part is in parentheses.  Is PWM not really supported?
Done
Probably came from the previous commit, but seems like we'd want to use the constant here?
Done

Nit: Are double quotes still needed?  If not, should they be removed here?

Sorry, I realize this was not exactly a change in this commit.  Just saw it here due to the refactoring (thanks!) of all this logic into a separate function.
Done
Odd commit message wrapping.
Ack

This can be removed since that's all handled at configure time and nothing under `control` will be built/included with `--disable-control` is given at configure time. Nothing special should need to be done with the makefile to achieve this and I dont see anything special added in this commit for that anyways.
Done

Isnt this already included from line 35?

I'm thinking this commit should actually move the build/inclusion of fanctl when WANT_JSON_CONTROL is true since sighups were not supported in YAML based configured fan control.

Up until this commit, fanctl would work for both JSON and YAML, however does not support `reloading` its config like JSON does thru sighups so lets just move all the "fanctl_*` entries under the `if WANT_JSON_CONTROL` directive below (line 70).
per our discussion, we'll just disable the reload() function for YAML-enable builds

Should directly add `#include "config.h"` to get this included..surprised this worked since the other includes done appear to indirectly pull this header in.

...so I pulled this commit down and I'm getting the YAML error below on a JSON config based machine, so this must be defaulting to `CONTROL_USE_JSON = 0` and once that include is added I assume it will work correctly.

```
root@p10bmc:~# ./fanctl status
Fan Control Service State   : loaded, active(running)

CurrentBMCState     : xyz.openbmc_project.State.BMC.BMCState.Ready
CurrentPowerState   : xyz.openbmc_project.State.Chassis.PowerState.On
CurrentHostState    : xyz.openbmc_project.State.Host.HostState.Off

 FAN        TARGET(RPM)  FEEDBACK(RPM)   PRESENT     FUNCTIONAL
===============================================================
 fan0         11200        7772/11200      true         true
 fan1         11200        7772/11200      true         true
 fan2         11200        7772/11200      true         true
 fan3         11200        7772/11200      true         true
 fan4         11200        7772/11200      true         true
 fan5         11200        7772/11200      true         true
root@p10bmc:~# ./fanctl reload
Error: reload function unavailable for YAML-configuration
```
Done
